description: From Latin eruptus, past participle of ērumpō (“to break out (of), to burst out (from)”), from e (“out”) + rumpō (“to break”).

verbs.description: erupt (third-person singular simple present erupts, present participle erupting, simple past and past participle erupted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To eject something violently (such as lava or water, as from a volcano or geyser).
examples: The volcano erupted, spewing lava across a wide area.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To burst forth; to break out.
examples: The third molar tooth erupts late in most people, and sometimes does not appear at all.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, figuratively) To spontaneously release pressure or tension.
(intransitive, biology) (Of birds, insects, etc.) To suddenly appear in a certain region in large numbers.
